intro: Hepetis latifolia var. cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban broadleaf hepetis, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
